channel.title: featured on I dream, therefore I am
channel.description: Recent content in featured on I dream, therefore I am

item.title: Groups, rings, BÃ©zout's identity, modular arithmetic and self-closing loop generators
item.description: 1 Introduction Daniel Fedorin investigated an intriguing phenomenon where rich patterns arise out of an extremely simple algorithm: Generate a finite sequence of integers, then iterate though the sequence repeatedly: at each step, draw a line segment of that integer length and then turn a fixed angle. This post extends Daniel's excellent work and delves deeper into the math behind this magic 1. Here is a demo for those who have yet to appreciate the magic.

item.title: Jane Street Puzzle solution: Robot Long Jump
item.description: Recently I found in my drawer some five pages of scribble dating back to Mar 2023, of my solution to that month's Jane Street Puzzle 1. Working on the puzzle was a wonderful process of meditation in a time of turmoil, and of reliving the peaceful memories of an aspiring student of math, statistics and computer science 2. Somewhat surprisingly, I was able to recall the techniques in calculus and probability theory I hadn't touched for years.
